module.name: Kotlin Solid State Relay controller
module.description: This module includes 6 solid state realy outputs. Kotlin board is initially intended for shutter control. Module hardware also incorporates several hardware features for future use, e.g. USB device port, RS485, 1-Wire. Nominal power supply 12/24V

abstraction.name: Channel 1 max up time
abstraction.description:
Setting for maximum UP time for this channel in 0.1s.
 By elapsing of this time channel will be put in state OFF and relay will be deactivated.
 Set to 0 to deactivate max UP time monitoring.

abstraction.name: Channel 1 max down time
abstraction.description:
Setting for maximum DOWN time for this channel in 0.1s.
 By elapsing of this time channel will be put in state OFF and relay will be deactivated.
 Set to 0 to deactivate max DOWN time monitoring.

abstraction.name: Relay pulse time register for relay 2
abstraction.description:
This is the pulse time for the each relay expressed in seconds. This can be used to have a relay turn on and off with a certain preset interval. The min pulse time is 1 second and the max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours. Set to zero (default) for no pulse time i.e. the relay will be steady on/off.

 To start a pulse sequence first write the pulse time to this register and then write 2 to the relay status register to start the output. The pulse train is terminated by writing on or off (1 or 0) to the relay status register.

abstraction.name: Relay protection time register relay 0
abstraction.description:
This is the relay protection time. A relay will be inactivated if not written to before this time has elapsed.

 Set to zero to disable (default). The max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours.

 The registers can be as an example be used as a security feature to ensure that an output is deactivated after a preset time even if the controlling device failed to deactivate the relay.
